title: Can't run tikv inside container
body:
## Bug Report

Can't run tikv inside container (cgroups)

### What version of TiKV are you using?
5.2.2

### What operating system and CPU are you using?
vendor_id       : GenuineIntel
model name      : Intel(R) Xeon(R) CPU E5-2698 v4 @ 2.20GHz

CentOS Linux release 7.6.1810 (Core)

[root@tikv1 tikv-20160]# cat /proc/version
Linux version 3.10.0-693.5.2.el7.jd_3313.x86_64 (root@localhost.localdomain) (gcc version 4.8.5 20150623 (Red Hat 4.8.5-16) (GCC) ) #1 SMP Wed May 2 14:35:41 CST 2018
[root@tikv1 tikv-20160]# uname -a
Linux tikv1 3.10.0-693.5.2.el7.jd_3313.x86_64 #1 SMP Wed May 2 14:35:41 CST 2018 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
[root@tikv1 tikv-20160]# uname -r
3.10.0-693.5.2.el7.jd_3313.x86_64

### Steps to reproduce
run it on container, directly or using tiup playground

### What did you expect?
run successfully

### What did happened?
crash


tiup error below:
```
Error: init config failed: xxx:20160: executor.ssh.execute_failed: Failed to execute command over SSH for 'tidb@xxx:22' {ssh_stderr: thread 'main' panicked at 'assertion failed: ret.insert(key, value).is_none()', components/tikv_util/src/sys/cgroup.rs:184:17
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace
, ssh_stdout: , ssh_command: export LANG=C; PATH=$PATH:/bin:/sbin:/usr/bin:/usr/sbin /export/tidb-deploy/tikv-20160/bin/tikv-server --config-check --config=/export/tidb-deploy/tikv-20160/conf/tikv.toml --pd "" --data-dir "/export/tidb-data/tikv-20160"}, cause: Process exited with status 101: check config failed
```

with manual startup
```
[root@tikv1 tikv-20160]# export RUST_BACKTRACE=1
[root@tikv1 tikv-20160]# export MALLOC_CONF="prof:true,prof_active:false"
[root@tikv1 tikv-20160]# bin/tikv-server \
>     --addr "0.0.0.0:20160" \
>     --advertise-addr "xxx:20160" \
>     --status-addr "0.0.0.0:20180" \
>     --advertise-status-addr "xxx:20180" \
>     --pd "xxx" \
>     --data-dir "/export/tidb-data/tikv-20160" \
>     --config conf/tikv.toml \
>     --log-file "/export/tidb-deploy/tikv-20160/log/tikv.log"
thread 'main' panicked at 'assertion failed: ret.insert(key, value).is_none()', components/tikv_util/src/sys/cgroup.rs:184:17
```

comments_data.body:
Sorry for the inconvenience. I think this is caused by a bug fixed on master: https://github.com/tikv/tikv/pull/11029

But the fix is not backported to the 5.2 release branch yet.

> Sorry for the inconvenience. I think this is caused by a bug fixed on master: #11029
> 
> But the fix is not backported to the 5.2 release branch yet.

Is there any plan to fix?

> > Sorry for the inconvenience. I think this is caused by a bug fixed on master: #11029
> > But the fix is not backported to the 5.2 release branch yet.
> 
> Is there any plan to fix?

Yes. It will be cherry picked to the 5.2 release in https://github.com/tikv/tikv/pull/11050 and will be included in 5.2.3. But I have no idea about when 5.2.3 will release (probably in half a month). So, if possible, you can try to compile yourself with that fix.
It's already merged into the 5.2 release branch. It will be brought out in the 5.2.4 release.
